item.title: Ariel Pakes
item.description: Ariel Pakes Research Associate at Harvard University. Ariel Pakes is the Thomas Professor of Economics in the Department of Economics at Harvard University and a research associate in the NBER’s Programs on Productivity, Innovation, and Entrepreneurship, and Industrial Organization.

item.title: ceteris paribus
item.description: Ceteris Paribus The latin name for [[other things equal]]. Comparisons made under ceteris paribus conditions have a causal interpretation. Imagine two students identical in every way, so their families have the same financial resources and their parents are similarly educated.

item.title: Submission T-Test 1
item.description: Submission T-Test 1 $H_0$: There is no significance of the humidity level from the mean. $H_1$: There is a significance of the humidity level from the mean.

item.title: Submission T-Test 2
item.description: Submission T-Test 2 $H_0$: There is no difference in the cholesterol levels between the genders. $H_1$: There is a difference in the cholesterol levels between the genders.

item.title: T-test
item.description: T-test The t-test is a test used for hypothesis testing in statistics and uses the t-statistic, the t-distribution values, and the degrees of freedom to determine statistical significance.

item.title: The Oregon Trail
item.description: The Oregon Trail Lottery in Oregon in 2008 where applicants could have a chance to win Health insurance. It was aimed at a special group of people (think low income Americans), and applicants won a chance to apply for the insurance.

item.title: Tv-Show Taboo
item.description: Tv-Show Taboo Taboo is a BBC television drama series produced by Scott Free London and Hardy Son & Baker. In 1814, James Delaney (Tom Hardy) returns to England after spending twelve years in Africa, following the death of his father and the approaching end of Great Britain’s war with the United States.
